Params[3]: ...It's a crimson sea.
The girl with grey long hair sits quietly next to the window, gazing into the galaxy outside.

To the people living on the Earth, an incredibly long time has passed. The battles fought against despair had turned into history, and history turned into legends. The legends were carved in the civilization's legacy, which eventually became fairy tales that parents told their children.

But to "them," this is just a short break before entering the next "warp." Time and distance have expanded infinitely following the spaceship's trail in the cosmic dust. Each step it ventures forward, it leaves hundreds and thousands of years behind.
DeLorean-Discovery continues to sail among the stars.
The girl's main consciousness is located in the center of the ship, but she still occasionally separates a trivial section of her computing power and projects it into this library as a hologram.
Mechanoids rarely visit here. The simulated gravity is constantly kept at 9.8 m/s2. Not even a dust has changed its position.

Not long ago, a girl's consciousness had crossed time and space to visit. They chatted for a long time, and she finally got her answer. She continued her journey toward the destined future, unwavering.
—That is why they all arrive here eventually.

Now the library is quiet again, the girl is still sitting next to the window. In her eyes is the reflection of a planet on the border of the galaxy. Its surface is always occupied by never-ending crimson tides that make it look like a burning planet when looked from afar.
This is but an ordinary planet on the spaceship's path. No lives of any form can survive here. The answer that machines have been looking for cannot be found here.
Still, its color makes the girl feel nostalgic. She remembers the future that she saw through Gestalt's calculation a long time ago.
...Captain Bianca from Purifying Force became a "witch" after picking up a weapon made with the Punishing Virus. She eventually sank with the fort into the depths of a contaminated ocean.
The young man in a black outfit looks abnormally calm, as if the tragic war was only an absurd dream in a distant world.
I am the Vice-Captain of the Purifying Force. Captain Bianca has gone missing during the search mission for "Scarlet Revelation". I will take over and continue the mission.
A female Construct that has never been witnessed before stands by the seaside. The seawater splashes her ankles. There is already a hint of red color inside.
Along with the seawater, a survived Construct also grabs Chiko's ankle. Its body can hardly be recognized. The broken vocal module is mumbling some incomprehensible words.
Help... Squelch... Yech...
Chiko has not even looked away. She just pierces through the broken humanoid's power core in silence.
The water surges. Her vision is blurred by a viscous red. Something has dissolved within the red and turned into thousands of Corrupted, reshaping their hosts and the Red Tide Projections.
A tall, skeletal humanoid walks out of the sea. A broken lamp falls off "her" waist, only to be trampled by the Hetero-Consciousness Hosts that swarm the beach.
Witch! "It's a witch!" She hears humans screaming amongst the mixed wailing and blunt noises of flesh being torn apart.

The signals of lives displayed in her terminal are rapidly disappearing. Nobody can stop "her," as they are no match for "her." Chiko looks up at the giant shadow as it walks over the waves, gradually engulfing her.
I have never thought that you would come to me in this form.
Something is struggling in "her" eyes, but it soon dies off. "Her" bluish lips draw a ghostly smile, but crimson tears roll down the corner of her eyes.
When I die... I don't want to see your tears, Captain.
Are you laughing at me?
Nobody could answer.
She raises her hands. Sharp fingertips sway past Chiko's face, then suddenly strangle her neck. Chiko feels her feet are off the ground.
...Not everybody can take the lives of their closest friends.
The number of life signals in her terminal has dropped to a single digit. Chiko hears the sound of her neck breaking. She also smiles, closing her eyes and letting go of her hands.
Vital fluid squirts out, falling into the dark seawater with her weapon.
Scarlet beams are shooting into the sky. A young man stands on the bridge of Babylonia, looking at the Constructs around him.
The dark muzzles of guns are pointing at his heart from all directions.
Sorry... It's all too late.
He also raises his gun.
This is%$—my final...■■Farewell...
Nanami?
A gentle female voice pulls her back from memories. It is one of the commonly used voices of Discovery's AI administrator.
Huh?
We have begun to approach the target wormhole. The next warp is expected to commence in 40 minutes.
The hologram of a white-haired female appears next to Nanami, with a hint of concern in her light golden eyes.
What's wrong?
Nothing. Some memories just came to me.
She raises her hand to open a light screen. It displays a document tagged with "Copperfield Aquarium Campaign".

Unlike the calculated ending, the reality went another path. After Bianca was injured, Chiko took over and headed to the bottom of the sea first. In this document, there are unnoticeable signs of adjustments and amendments regarding the allocation of their duties.
What had happened to alter the inevitable disaster that took place in the calculation?
Inadvertently, she glances at a photo of a lamp in the document. Finally figuring it out, she casts away the light screen and opens a new time-space map, then enters a set of coordinates.
The light spot runs along the information tree, finally stopping at the marked location.
Haicma, can you help me pack up File No. 2143 and make it ready for 4-dimensional communication? There's something I'd like to send to the Earth.
Understood.
...Are you sure this is what you want to send?
Slightly uncertain, the AI asks Nanami after extracting the information she wanted.
The humans on the Earth have already mastered all the related technologies. This information is already outdated to them.
You're right.
The girl points at the time-space coordinates on the display.
I'm sending it here.
But mankind didn't have the ability to receive 4-dimensional communications at that point of time. Besides...
I know.
With a delighted smile, the girl puts one finger next to her lips.
That brief moment is their only chance.
With the Phantom Tracer and lots of Hetero-Creatures...
As long as there is a fragment that has the 4-dimensional feature, it can become the vessel for this information.
Besides, they have to look for the "door" themselves. I'm only sending a fragment of the key.
...Understood.
Seeing the girl's smile, the AI's expression has also softened.
The information has been encapsulated. Time-space coordinates locked. It will be sent out during Discovery's wormhole warp.
The engine is about to start. We should go to the control room.
Alright.

She turns off the time-space map and rises to her feet, preparing to send all computing power back to the control center. The light screen is set to standby, displaying a slow-spinning illusion of a blue planet amidst the brilliant stars.

She takes one last look at the blue planet. Discovery has crossed numerous spiral arms of galaxies. She has been to so many radiant stars and witnessed so many majestic views, but none of the planets can match its beauty.
This is my gift to them... The "future."
She speaks softly as her illusion gradually disappears. The library is once again empty.
The shooting star carrying the information will travel back in time, heading to its destination.
